intro: Calystegia affinis, commonly known as the common morning glory, is a climbing vine native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Convolvulaceae and is characterized by its trumpet-shaped flowers that open in the morning. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces showy, often purple or blue, flowers. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found along fences or in disturbed areas. Calystegia affinis is known for its rapid growth and can become invasive in certain regions.
